comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: How delightful to know they have a preserved section of track and locomotive at Listowel, Co. Kerry. The locomotive is a diesel powered replica (not steam) ! www.lartiguemonorail.com/ www.lartiguemonorail.com/history.php (History of the Listowel to Ballybunion line, 1888-1924). en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lartigue_Monorail (A more detailed article about the line and it's locomotive). Stuart.

comment._content: Know nothing of locomotion, but it appears to have had twin boilers for weight distribution?

comment.author: 60812213@N04
comment._content: There was an original piece of track in a garden near Lisselton that I saw 3 years ago. Just the track, no engine but a carriage. This is not my photo. www.ramblingroundireland.com/markphotos.html

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/abandonedrailsireland] If you're anywhere near Listowel over the next while there're some great trips planned: "a short demonstration journey on a full-scale diesel-powered replica of the original monorail. During the journey you will experience the unique features of the monorail and will observe its ingenious switching system..."
